excerpts.title: A Year of Writing
excerpts.body:
They say a monkey hitting keys at random will reproduce the works of Shakespeare, eventually. I only had a year but I did manage to produce something worthy of sharing. Here’s a recap of my best efforts, as inadvertently voted by you:
Most Shared of 2012

The State of Web Design, 2013 10 Dec — 60 shares
The […]

excerpts.title: A Responsive Off-Canvas Menu
excerpts.body:
Have a play with my responsive off-canvas menu. I hadn’t intended this to go viral (I’m well aware of the issues!) but since it has I decided to write a proper introduction.


A couple of things to note — this was purely a technical demo to see the performance of CSS transforms & transitions (I’ve built […]

excerpts.title: The State of Web Design, 2013
excerpts.body:
To wrap up 2011 I wrote a few thoughts on web design looking forward. Because I found it so helpful to remain focused with this personal reference, I’m doing it again this year.
I encourage you to do the same!
This all stemmed from a tweet back in October. It’s fine to observe and copy trends, but […]

excerpts.title: Responsive Day Out
excerpts.body:
I’ll be speaking at the Responsive Day Out conference in Brighton, 1st March 2013. Grab a ticket now because at £50+VAT they’ll be sold out very soon! And they’re gone!


Jeremy Keith explains more on his blog.
It’s a kind of conference, I guess, but I think of it as more like a gathering of like-minded people […]

excerpts.title: The Mobile Book
excerpts.body:
Smashing Magazine’s The Mobile Book is due for dispatch soon. Having had the opportunity to read it I’ll cut to the chase for those deliberating a purchase: it’s well worth the cover price. The e-book edition is a steal!


Let it be known that this book goes beyond designing for the Web. The core themes are […]

excerpts.title: Responsive Bases & Vertical Spaces
excerpts.body:
Build a responsive design and you’ll find yourself knee deep in relative units and percentage widths. Media queries are the weapon of choice to adjust CSS on viewport change. Almost every example I’ve seen (and made) are based exclusively on the viewport width.
What about height?
The Baseline Grid
As an exercise in ‘perfection’ when I last updated […]

excerpts.title: Design Books for Sale
excerpts.body:
Based in the UK? Like design, books, design books, book design?
I’ve got just what you need. I’m selling a few of my design books. These are all top notch and have served me well (some since the uni days). Today I’m all digital and sadly have no room for a physical book collection. I want […]
